name: Audacity
description: A free, cross-platform digital audio editor.

name: audio.js
description: audio.js is a drop-in javascript library that allows HTML5's <audio> tag to be used anywhere.

name: howler.js
description: A Javascript audio library for the modern web.

name: JSyn
description: An audio synthesis software API for Java.

name: Librosa
description: A python package for music and audio analysis, providing the building blocks necessary to create music information retrieval systems.

name: midi.js
description: A framework for creating web-based MIDI apps.

name: PortAudio
description: A free, cross-platform, open-source, audio I/O library.

name: RustAudio
description: An aggregate of free and useful Audio, DSP and music libraries written in Rust.

name: Soundpipe
description: A lightweight DSP library written in C.

name: Beets
description: A powerful command-line music organizer and manipulator.

name: Koel
description: An open-source personal audio streaming server.

name: Lame
description: A high quality, free and open-source MP3 encoder.

name: lltag
description: Automatic command-line mp3/ogg/flac file tagger and renamer.

name: Musikernel
description: A futuristic audio production platform (hardware support, APIs, hosts, plugins and more)

name: SoX
description: A free open-source command line utility for playing, converting and manipulating audio files.

name: Ciconia's music
description: A collection of mostly baroque music, lots of sacred works by J. S. Bach, coded in lilypond/ripple.

name: CPDL
description: The choral public domain library contains more than 20K free scores of vocal music.

name: Ã‰ditions Nicolas Sceaux
description: Baroque music scores (mainly French music), typeset using lilypond.

name: IMSLP
description: The International Music Score Library Project is the largest collection of public domain scores and parts on the web.

name: Mutopia
description: Sheet music based on editions in the public domain.

name: Timidity
description: TiMidity++ is an open-source command line synthesizer that plays MIDI files.

name: Abjad
description: a Python API for Formalized Score Control, based on Lilypond.

name: Denemo
description: A free music notation editor based on Lilypond.

name: Frescobaldi
description: A free Lilypond sheet music editor.

name: Inknote
description: Free, open source, browser based music notation and composition software

name: LibMEI
description: LibMEI is a C++ library for reading and writing MEI files.

name: Lilypond
description: Free, open-source music engraving program, devoted to producing the highest-quality sheet music possible.

name: Lilybin
description: An open sourcle web-based lilypond editor.

name: Lilyvm
description: Lilypond version manager.

name: Lydown
description: A modern language for music notation, based on Lilypond.

name: MuseScore
description: Free open-source music notation and composition software.

name: OpenLilyLib
description: LilyPond tools - snippets, templates, and extensions.

name: Python-ly
description: Tool and library for manipulating LilyPond files.

name: Ripple
description: DRY for Lilypond - generate scores and parts with minimal fuss.

name: Verovio
description: A library and a toolkit for engraving MEI music notation into SVG.

name: Vexflow
description: A JavaScript library for rendering music notation and guitar tablature.

name: Alda
description: A music programming language for musicians.

name: Chuck
description: Strongly-timed, concurrent, and on-the-fly music programming language.

name: CoffeeCollider
description: A language for real time audio synthesis and algorithmic composition in HTML5. "Write CoffeeScript, and be processed as SuperCollider."

name: Common Music
description: An open source music composition system.

name: Csound
description: A user-programmable and user-extensible sound processing language and software synthesizer.

name: IanniX
description: A graphical open-source sequencer, based on Iannis Xenakis works, for digital art.

name: Music Suite
description: A language for generalized music notation and theory, based on Haskell.

name: Overtone
description: Overtone is an Open Source toolkit for designing synthesizers and collaborating with music.

name: Platonic Music Engine
description: An open-source music generation framework written in Lua.

name: Sporth
description: A small stack based audio language.

name: SuperCollider
description: SuperCollider is a programming language for real time audio synthesis and algorithmic composition.

name: OpenMusicTheory
description: A growing, online "textbook" for music theory and aural skills.

name: MEI (Music Encoding Initiative)
description: An open-source effort to define a system for encoding musical documents in a machine-readable structure.

name: MusicXML
description: The standard open format for exchanging digital sheet music.

name: SMuFL (Standard Music Font Layout)
description: A specification for mapping music symbols to Unicode for use in music fonts.
